pull.title: Add PeerTableModel::StatsRole to prevent data layer violation
pull.body:
This PR allows to access to the `CNodeCombinedStats` instance directly from any view object.

The `PeerTableModel::getNodeStats` member function removed as a kind of layer violation.

No behavior changes.

Also other pulls (bugfixes) are based on this one: #18 and #164.

repo.name: gui
repo.description: Bitcoin Core GUI staging repository. Please do not fork unless for development reasons.

rename.to: Add PeerTableModel::StatsRole to prevent data layer violation

events.body: Light ACK 4c05fe01ed05b549558f135cddbe720ba568ecbc with the caveat that I don't know the qt framework or this code well. Saw no regression while manually testing. A few suggestions below to aid in reading and understanding the code.

events.body:
Updated 4c05fe01ed05b549558f135cddbe720ba568ecbc -> b3e9bcaac85a64a1b41d534b28c8cfb1f08e14e5 ([pr161.02](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr161.02) -> [pr161.03](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr161.03)):

- addressed @jonatack and @promag's comments
- rebased to prevent conflicts in pulls that based on this one (#18 and #164)

Tested re-ACK b3e9bcaac85a64a1b41d534b28c8cfb1f08e14e5 per `git range-diff ae8f797 4c05fe0 b3e9bca`

Thanks for updating.

comments.body: 644f5f5 I'm not very familiar with the gui code, but this enum seems an odd way to do this. Maybe an explanatory comment would be good.

As an alternative, a simple `constexpr` could be used (it seems better for me), but here I use the way how we already did such things:
https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/blob/f1f26b8d5baec4a45a3a9ba0440cd4eff7af8407/src/qt/addresstablemodel.h#L36-L38

https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/blob/f1f26b8d5baec4a45a3a9ba0440cd4eff7af8407/src/qt/bitcoinunits.h#L91-L94

https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/blob/f1f26b8d5baec4a45a3a9ba0440cd4eff7af8407/src/qt/coincontroldialog.h#L82-L86

https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/blob/f1f26b8d5baec4a45a3a9ba0440cd4eff7af8407/src/qt/transactiontablemodel.h#L46

@promag What do you think?

[AAA Style (Almost Always Auto)](https://herbsutter.com/2013/08/12/gotw-94-solution-aaa-style-almost-always-auto/)

> ... easier to understand what is going on

Maybe `GUIUtil::getEntryData` requires renaming? `GetModelIndexesByColumn`?

@promag What do you think?
Type is already in `.value<>()`, IIRC `auto` can be used when the type is clear from the statement.

Right, this follow Qt approach, I guess they didn't want to manually assign a value to each role.

With multiple roles `constexpr` looks weird because you'd have to manually increment for each custom role.

Side node, I'd just ditch `getEntryData` and `hasEntryData`, doesn't improve that much over Qt API. If we keep them then maybe reword to `GetSelectedModelIndex` or something like that with "selection".

In this particular case I think `peer` should have the type, and leave auto for `stats`.

Re AAA Style, yes, Sutter states the caveat about readability is that people use IDEs. Here, where review is the primary constraint, whatever can aid reviewers in reading and reviewing the code seems like a win, so in practice I've found myself using `auto` only when the type is obvious or when it can avoid a complicated, verbose type. Anyway, just a minor suggestion, feel free to ignore.

@promag 
> ... this follow Qt approach...

In the [recent example](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5.12/qtwidgets-painting-basicdrawing-example.html) they use
```
const int IdRole = Qt::UserRole;
```


> With multiple roles `constexpr` looks weird because you'd have to manually increment for each custom role.

Agree.

Also https://stackoverflow.com/questions/899917/why-do-people-use-enums-in-c-as-constants-while-they-can-use-const
